transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Is your hair as dull and lifeless as your brain? Didn't work start at 9? Where's your shirt? Did you even remember to wear it? I know you. I used to be you. Until I discovered Chambraigne.

transcript.speaker: Al Roker
transcript.dialogue: Shampoo for your hair, and your brain!

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Al. And here's how it works.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: Other shampoos just work on your hair. But Chambraigne travels down each follicle and bores into your skull, depositing magical knowledge crystals.

transcript.speaker: TV's Al Roker
transcript.dialogue: ("Heavy User"): Lather your way to a new intelligence.

transcript.speaker: Announcer
transcript.dialogue: With Chambraigne. The shampoo of kings. (Faster) Made by Carl and Sons. Continued use may result in limb Loss.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Finally, a product for me! I believe every word that man just said, because it's exactly what I wanted to hear.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ha ha ha ha! I'm already smart enough to know this is working!

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: This is a proud day for Carl and Sons, son. (two brains hover in shadow)

transcript.speaker: Large brain
transcript.dialogue: (Carl) We've sold enough Chambraigne to purchase this...television.

transcript.speaker: Small brain
transcript.dialogue: (Son) (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: Yes, son. Fetch daddy's hard plastic eyes so he can see the TV.

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: On the dresser! You are an imbecile!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings! I'm Number One! And I got this way because I use Chambraigne! But what's "Chambraigne," Space Ghost? Well, let me tell you what Chambraigne is. Chambraigne is an "intelli-hancer." (trumpet)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Man, you've been brainwashed!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're right it's a brain-wash! And it's good for your hair, too!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bob's here. (clears throat)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Is this product for everyone, Space Ghost? (Laughs.) No, no, no. This product is not for everyone. Only for those who buy, and choose to use, the product.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bob's here.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You know what I've always wanted to do? (Pause.) Have a Nerf war in a huge mansion!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Bob's here!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, really? (pause). Chambraigne? I'll catch you on the flipside. (trumpet)

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Greetings, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob, for legal reasons beyond our control, and to honor the queen, identify yourself...to me...the king.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Bob Costas, NBC Sports. Hello, universe.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, when you say "Bob Costas," what do you mean by that?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: You know, it's...it's uh...(laughing) something I haven't given much thought to, actually.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, I have. (pause) It's your name, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Ye...Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (thinking to himself) This shampoo is awesome!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Bob! Look at me!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm burning a hole in your head with my Mind.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ha ha! What a sticky wicket! Zorak's mind is obviously too small. He has no hair. He can't make use of Chambraigne. It's like the domino theory of stupidity. Isn't that obvious to Everyone?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh dear.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey, Bob! This Pete Rose thing. How does that guy not wind up in the Hall?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: It's a travesty.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Re-attaching arm) Okay. All right.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I mean 4,256 hits. Nobody's touchin' that record.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Well, my favorite athlete as a kid growing up was Mickey Mantle. I grew up...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob...

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: ...in New York and the Yankees were the dominant...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob! Bob!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Well, you...you...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob, that thing over there is a villain. He knows nothing. He's obviously trying to lure you into some sort of a sports death trap! So now, Bob, listen to my important question.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's the difference between a "boont" and a "poont"?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: A "bunt," first of all, would happen in baseball...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob, hold on. We all know what a "bunt" is. We're talking about the "boont." The French "boont." Or English. Whatever.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: You know, I...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You clearly have no idea what you're talking about you handsome, sophisticated, hyper-intelligent, svelte, well-read, sparkling, salty, olive-complected, full-head-of-haired Man!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Well, you know you have to...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I AM THE KING!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Don't you feel special about that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (thinking to himself) Bob smells like a chili dog. And his hair is huge. Could he be using Chambraigne?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (thinking to himself) Now with weiner scent?

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: There is no weiner scent, you hooded buffoon!

transcript.speaker: Son
transcript.dialogue: (squeaking) Awww....

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: He's making a mockery of the product. You're making a mockery of the product!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: How mu...how much hair do you have, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (with lather on hood) Oh, I don't know. Nine. Nine fat stalks.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Well, why if...if, Space Ghost, if you weren't concerned about your own dome, why would you be so concerned and perhaps envious of those who have a full head of hair?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Right.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Wanna see my brain?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: What's that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Get out here and heat up my skull! Now this is something, Bob, you don't ever wanna do.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: All right. This is gonna hurt. Bad.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Right now Moltar is heating my skull up to a scorching 450 degrees. (Space Ghost's hood glows red) It's like getting a scalp massage...from Lucifer.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: It sounds dangerous. It sounds downright frightening.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It is. You see, my brain's sending a message to my arms right now to put my head out. But I'm choosing to ignore that.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Uh-huh. Hello, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Hi, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, don't talk to the guests. Things get easier as your brain dies, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: I know.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There she is, Bob. (trumpet swell, Space Ghost's brain shows through his hood all the way down to his neck) Brains!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: I'm impressed. I'm very impressed, Space Ghost. But then, I was impressed to begin with.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You, uh, wanna know why I did this, Bob?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Please.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: To prove a point. A point, Bob, which escapes me right now. I have to go stick my head in the lake.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: How sad was that?

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: Sales will plummet! All because of this beef-witted Klingon!

transcript.speaker: Son
transcript.dialogue: (squeaking) Oh, Daddy!

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: Fetch daddy's blue fright wig! I must be handsome when I unleash my rage.

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: It's on the dresser, next to the keys! I've told you a million times!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Then, you know, it's been pretty much oozin' ever since. What do you think of that?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: It disgusts me.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Me too. And I gotta live with it.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Hmmm.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, flush the lake.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: We don't have a lake.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good work. Bob?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Yes, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob...

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hello.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Hello, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I have one final question for you. As a carbon-based sex machine...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Smooth-chested, no doubt.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was just gonna say that! It's amazing. We've been working together so long...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: We finish each other's sentences.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, you know, it's like I always say...when I'm in the shower... (looks at Zorak, then sings) Shower time!! That's what I always say, Bob. When I'm showering.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, Bob, I have one more final question for you. Do you have the freedom to wear comfortable, open-toed shoes?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: I could, yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, I'd...actually, though, it's not advisable when doing a football game in Green Bay in December to wear sandals.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob, everyone knows Green Bay is not in December. You obviously don't shampoo. Here's my final question, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah? I thought that was the last question.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who told ya that?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: All right, what is it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That was it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Did you just call me a monkey? Huh?!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: I, Space Ghost, I didn't...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, big man. Come on!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: I, I'm not a man who believes...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, let's go!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: ...in violence, Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, Costas! Start somethin'!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Nah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Nah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You want a piece of me?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Nah.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: (announcing) Space Ghost, eyeing Zorak.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Ready to deliver the knock-out blow.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Come on, Zorak, start somethin'. Come on, you want a piece of the king?!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: One of his Archenemies.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The monkey king?!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: In his sights.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No. Not really.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What? Say that to my face.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I didn't say anything!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: And he zaps him, zaps him but good.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (flies down hallway)

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: He's gone yard on Zorak. He's taken him deep. He's taken him over the boards.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Put that in your pipe and smoke it! With your burned lips!

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: It's a tape-measure blast of Zorak that ought to eliminate the little creep for the foreseeable future.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (from hallway) I didn't do anything!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You were driving away the fans.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: He was. He was asking for it. And all superheroes, all men of honor and virtue, only resort to violence...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I didn't ask you, Bob.

transcript.speaker: Bob Costas
transcript.dialogue: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Sorry" is a word that knows no boundaries. Now kiss my ring.

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: SILENCE!!

transcript.speaker: Son
transcript.dialogue: (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: (to SON:) Shut! Shut! If you had a neck and I had hands, I would squeeze your brain, which is your body, right out the top of your head, which does not exist!

transcript.speaker: Son
transcript.dialogue: (remorseful squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's some great hair.

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: Thanks. It's not real.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Welcome, fans.

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: We are far from fans. I am Carl. This is my son, Little Carl.

transcript.speaker: Little Carl
transcript.dialogue: (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: We're from Carl and Son's. We are both Carls.

transcript.speaker: Little Carl
transcript.dialogue: (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: (to Little Carl) Shut up! Shut up!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Carl & Son's? What a coincidence! I buy my Chambraigne from them! It's shampoo for your brain.

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: Fool! We know what it is! We make it!

transcript.speaker: Little Carl
transcript.dialogue: (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're the inventors of the specially-patented formula for intelligence?

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: It's only dishwasher liquid, you over-inflated gasbag!

transcript.speaker: Little Carl
transcript.dialogue: (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh-huh. And the knowledge crystals?

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: (Mimicking) "Uh-huh and the knowledge cryst--"? Aquarium gravel.

transcript.speaker: Little Carl
transcript.dialogue: (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: (to Little Carl) SHUT!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I, I don't care how you do it. I just know it's working for me!

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: It doesn't work! It's psychosomatic! It's a placebo!

transcript.speaker: Little Carl
transcript.dialogue: (incoherent squeaking)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh, those are big words. Maybe I should wash my hair again.

transcript.speaker: Carl
transcript.dialogue: Noooo!! Can you not comprehend that your ignorance will cause me to explode now? Arrgghhh!!!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Let's stop right there. If someone approached you about washing your hair, (Space Ghost's left arm falls off) what would you say to them? I'll tell you what you should say. You'd say, "Thanks, but no thanks. I don't need large brains to have a good time."

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You wanna be groovy, huh? You wanna fit in? Wanna go to the big dance? Wanna be the king? You'll be the fool! Shampoo will play you for the fool!

transcript.speaker: Female Voice
transcript.dialogue: Okay, well, thank you for coming.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I'm not done. I'm serious. These brains, they're out there. They're shining. With eyes of hard plastic. And blue hair. Blue as the night!
